name: Kennedy Krieger Institute
description: World-renowned center for pediatric developmental disabilities, including autism diagnosis, treatment, and research.

name: Pathfinders for Autism
description: Maryland's leading autism resource organization providing support, resources, and community events for families.

name: Autism Society of America - Maryland Chapters
description: Local chapters providing support groups, advocacy, and community connections throughout Maryland.

name: Maryland Center for Developmental Disabilities (MCDD)
description: Part of Kennedy Krieger, providing interdisciplinary services and policy advocacy for developmental disabilities.

name: The Arc Maryland
description: Advocates for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities, including autism, across Maryland.

name: Maryland Autism Waiver Program
description: State Medicaid waiver providing home and community-based services for individuals with autism.

name: Ivymount School
description: Non-public special education school serving students with autism and other learning differences.

name: The Forbush School at Hunt Valley
description: Sheppard Pratt's therapeutic day school for students with autism and emotional disabilities.

name: RICA (Regional Institute for Children and Adolescents)
description: Public residential and day school program for students with autism and emotional disabilities.

name: Autism Speaks Maryland
description: National autism organization with Maryland-specific resources, walks, and advocacy efforts.

name: Parents' Place of Maryland
description: Parent Training and Information Center helping families navigate special education and disability services.

name: Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration (DDA)
description: State agency coordinating services for individuals with developmental disabilities including autism.

name: Hussman Institute for Autism
description: Research institute focused on understanding autism causes and developing effective interventions.

name: University of Maryland Autism Research Consortium
description: Multi-disciplinary research group studying autism across the lifespan.

name: Autism Intervention Research Network (AIR-P)
description: NIH-funded network including Maryland sites researching autism interventions.

name: Camp Accomplish
description: Summer camp and year-round programs for children and teens with autism and developmental disabilities.

name: Therapeutic Recreation at Maryland-National Capital Park
description: Adaptive recreation programs for individuals with disabilities in Montgomery and Prince George's counties.

name: Autism Waiver Self-Direction
description: Maryland program allowing families to self-direct autism waiver services and hire their own staff.

name: ASAN (Autistic Self Advocacy Network)
description: Autistic-led organization advocating for disability rights and neurodiversity acceptance.

name: Maryland Infants and Toddlers Program
description: Early intervention services for children birth to 3 with developmental delays, including autism.
